column1: The '''North Moors''' lay along the northern border of [[the Shire]] in the [[Northfarthing]].<ref>{{FR
column2: Hobbits}}</ref>  It was the one place within the Shire where heavy snowfalls were common.<ref>{{FR

column3: Tree-men]] or [[giants]] away beyond the North Moors.<ref>{{FR

column1: Assuming that Halfast's story is not a fanciful fabrication and indeed he saw something strange, [[fandom
column2: fans]] have connected the "tree-man" to the [[Ents]] (or [[Entwives]]) that appear later in the story. However [[J.R.R. Tolkien
column3: Tolkien]] specifically mentioned that he had not invented the Ents before the moment he reached the chapter ''[[Treebeard (chapter)
column5: 231}}</ref> and the "tree-man" reference was written before it.<ref>{{HM
column6: RS}}, pp. 253-254</ref> It is unknown whether Tolkien himself consciously considered such a connection or if he revisited the matter subsequently.<ref>{{webcite
